snippet: Roger Cohen, upon re-reading Saul Bellow’s “Herzog,” elaborates on the idea that some books may be read at the wrong time in one’s life, and suggests timings for the reading of a few classics.
abstract: Roger Cohen, upon re-reading Saul Bellow’s “Herzog,” elaborates on the idea that some books may be read at the wrong time in one’s life, and suggests timings for the reading of a few classics.

headline.main: Roger Cohen: When to Read What I’ve Read
